item.title: kksou says:
item.description: Hi Greg, 1) First, make sure you have entered the Google Maps API key. You can apply it here: https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/get-api-key. Note that Google now requires that you enable billing. Details in that web page. 2) you are not in United States, then make sure you put in your country at the end of the address. Otherwise you will receive the error "Google cannot decode your address". E.g. googleMaps addr="Via Venti Settembre 25, 00187 Rome, Italy" Note: please put in the curly bracket above. I didn't put in here because it will turn into a google map. 3) Try to make sure the googlemaps work first before testing googleDir or googleDir_to_here. The other 2 plugins run on top of googleMaps plugin. If the googleMaps plugin does not work, the other 2 plugins will also not work. Please give the above a try and let me know if it works. Warm Regards, /kksou
item.dc:creator: kksou

item.title: GREG says:
item.description: Hi, I have installed all 3 plugins and when i enter my current location i get the error Google cannot decode your address: Any help please
item.dc:creator: GREG

item.title: kksou says:
item.description: Hi Rene, this website is currently running on the latest Joomla 3.8.12. You can try the demo above. It's working fine... Warm Regards, /kksou
item.dc:creator: kksou

item.title: rene summers says:
item.description: Is there a version to work on Joomla 3.8.x? the 3.0x version is not working.
item.dc:creator: rene summers

item.title: kksou says:
item.description: Hi Stuart, Yes, there have been quite a number of requests to add the print function over the years. Have tried it. But the Google Maps API does not provide a simple way to print the displayed map and directions. If anyone has managed to get it working and do not mind sharing, please send me the code and I will add the print functionality to the new version to share with the rest of the people using this plugin. Warm Regards, /kksou
item.dc:creator: kksou

item.title: Stuart Newton says:
item.description: Brilliant plugin, works a treat, the only thing missing, is a "Print" button, having this next to the "Get Directions" would complete this plugin to its fullest. 5 stars.... :lol:
item.dc:creator: Stuart Newton

item.title: kksou says:
item.description: Hi Bob, Just tried it on your web site. Yes, it's working! Didn't know about the plugin "jqueryeasy". Learned something from you too! Glad it's working for you now! Warm Regards, /kksou
item.dc:creator: kksou

item.title: Bob Martin says:
item.description: kksou: Your alerting me to the issue of conflict between mootools and jquery enabled me to find a solution. I installed the jqueryeasy plug-in and set it to disable mootools on my directions page. Your plug-in works on that page now. Thanks for your add-in and your help. Best regards, Bob Martin
item.dc:creator: Bob Martin

item.title: Barrett says:
item.description: Thanks for getting back to me and for updating me on the situation. One interesting thing is when I go to the same site on a different server it works fine on my mobile devices when holding the phone landscape. Check it out http://aroostookmedia.com/ace/index.php/our-locations I'll await notification when the update is available. Thanks.
item.dc:creator: Barrett

item.title: kksou says:
item.description: Hi Barrett, Open your website in a browser on your desktop and then try to make the width of the browser window smaller (simulating the width of a smartphone). You will see the map is actually still there on the right. It's just that it's now hidden. See, the current version uses standard HTML table. When I wrote this code many years back, mobile is not popular. So I didn't design the whole thing to be responsive. Yes, I' now working on a responsive version for this so that it works with smartphone. Wanted to roll it out during Christmas holidays, but it turns out it's more complicated that I thought. Might need another 2 to 4 weeks to iron out all the issues. Will let you know as soon as I released the new version, ok? Wam Regards, /kksou
item.dc:creator: kksou

item.title: kksou says:
item.description: Hi Bob, 1) If you do a view source of your web page and follow the link "/plugins/system/jch_optimize/cache/jscss.php?f=3b f7b1a915daa09456ccd6e528f2a0c4-cache-plg_jch_optim ize-699a61285b80a12077214eed9c0cb490 type=js gz=gz d=30" you will see the first line that says "this.MooTools={version:"1.4.5"" So your template is indeed using MooTools, as what I've suspected. Most of the other users encountering this error is also using MooTools. 2) I checked your "JoomlaShine Epic Pro" template website. I think they have an updated version for Joomla 3.0. May I know if you also upgraded your Joomla template, or you did not make any changes to the Joomla template (i.e. still using the same Joomla template for joomla 2.5.28) 3) I'm not too sure if your template uses jQuery. The default Joomla 3 template uses jQuery. You said your site is now running Joomla 3. But I do not see any line that loads the jQuery library. By the way, you said that "I have been using it since 2013 without problem." Are you using the same "JoomlaShine Epic Pro" template since 2013? Did you change your joomla template from 2013 until now? Warm Regards, /kksou
item.dc:creator: kksou

item.title: Bob Martin says:
item.description: kksou: 1) I've googled to try and find out but still don't know how to tell whether a template or plug-in is using MooTools. My Joomla template is JoomlaShine Epic Pro. The Joomla plug-in manager lists over 30 plug-ins--for most I have no idea what they do (I can send you a PDF of the listing if that would help). 2) Same answer. 3) 2.5.28, updated yesterday from 2.5.14--same map problem on both. I haven't tried Joomla 3.x yet since (a) I only succeeded late yesterday in updating to 2.5.28 (after a week of failing to use the update feature, I finally just force copied the patch files using FileZilla), and (b) I don't know yet if the Go Daddy server I am on supports 3.x. I've tried running your plug-in with "Template uses JQuery" set to "Yes" and then to "No"--and get errors both ways. I just set it back to "Yes" so you can see the errors I get that way. Beats me how you have the time to be so responsive, but I do appreciate it. Best regards, Bob Martin
item.dc:creator: Bob Martin

item.title: kksou says:
item.description: Hi Bob, I did some googling. The error "TypeError: window.addEvent is not a function" seems to be common with Joomla sites using MooTools. 1) Is your Joomla template, or any of your plugins, using MooTools? 2) Does your Joomla template also load JQuery? 3) Which Joomla version is your site running? Please let me know so that I can propose ways to resolve the errors. Warm Regards, /kksou
item.dc:creator: kksou

item.title: Bob Martin says:
item.description: I am tremendously impressed with the promptness of your response. I inspected the page in Chrome and did see some errors but don't know what I might do with them. You can see the page here: http://www.robertcmartinlawoffice.com (click on Get Directions link in the left column to go to the mapping page). Thanks a million.
item.dc:creator: Bob Martin

item.title: kksou says:
item.description: Hi Bob, I need more info to know where might be the problem. Can you turn on the developer tools of your browser and take a look at the javascript console to see if you see any error message displayed there? Alternatively, you can also let me know the URL of your webpage and I can go there to take a look. Warm Regards, /kksou
item.dc:creator: kksou

item.title: Bob Martin says:
item.description: Nice plug-in. I have been using it since 2013 without problem. However, it now does not display the map or get directions--possibly due to change in Google Maps API Key requirement. I'm running Joomla! 2.5.14 on GoDaddy. I have downloaded the most recent tohere package, enabled all three plug-ins, added to all three plug-ins the API key I got from google, and left this in the article field of my Get Directions page (which used to work): {googleDir_tohere width=100% height=400 dir_width=275 vertical=1 home_addr="304 West Park Street, Franklin PA 16323" home_label="Robert C. Martin Law Office~304 West Park Street~Franklin PA 16323"}. I can see that the code is being executed by the visibility and layout of the "coming from" textbox and "get directions" button, but no map, and the button doesn't get directions. Any suggestions?
item.dc:creator: Bob Martin

item.title: kksou says:
item.description: Hi David, Thanks for your feedback. Yes, there have been quite a number of user requests on this too. I'm currently working on a new version to include other new features such as transit mode (e.g. by bus, subway, bicycle, etc.). Will also incorporate what you've suggested into the new version. I have some time during this holiday season. Will try to get the new version out latest by Christmas. Warm Regards, /kksou
item.dc:creator: kksou

item.title: David says:
item.description: Hi Thanks for the tutorial. I now have the "From" field. Is there any way to have the directions panel BELOW the map? The reason I ask is that the plugin does not act responsively so is of little use on a smartphone. Regards, David
item.dc:creator: David

item.title: kksou says:
item.description: Hi Pascal, Have just sent you an email. I used exactly the same code as yours. As you can see, the map seems to be displayed correctly. Please take a look at the javascript console and let me know what error message you see there. Warm Regards, /kksou
item.dc:creator: kksou

item.title: Pascal Bouman says:
item.description: Hi. I'm trying to use the googleDirections to here Plugin on my Joomla website with version 1.5.26. The installation was succesful. I have entered the following code into an article: [googleDir_tohere width=400 height=360 dir_width=275 home_addr="52.0176089, 5.435080299999981"] When I load the webpage, the map is very shortly shown, but then after the map is gone and the website (dutch) announces: Oeps! Er is iets misgegaan. (oeps, something went wrong) Google Maps is niet correct geladen op deze pagina. (Google Maps was not loaded correctly on this page)Zie de JavaScript-console voor technische details. (Check the JavaScript-console for technical details) Can you help me with this? Best regards, Pascal Bouman
item.dc:creator: Pascal Bouman

item.title: kksou says:

item.title: kksou says:
item.description: Hi Sean, Most of the plugins and modules you see here are those that I use on my own website. I thought it's quite useful and decide to share with the rest through joomla.org. I'm ok with PHP programming, but not good in responsive design. If anyone knows how to change this into a responsive design, please let me know, and I will be more than happy to add them into the code. Thanks and Regards, /kksou
item.dc:creator: kksou

item.title: SeanR says:
item.description: Hello, I was wondering if you had a responsive version of this plugin?
item.dc:creator: SeanR

item.title: kksou says:
item.description: Hi, I know what you want. But problem is Google does not provide any API for this. If you want to achieve that, you need to write quite a bit of code. I can do that if it's my own site, because I can add codes to my own page. But to make it a generic Joomla plugin that runs on any site, it's a bit of a challenge, because I don't have write access to your page. I need to run some javascript when your page is loaded - this requires you to add some javascript to your page yourself. I don't think anyone knows how to do this, and everyone is comfortable doing this. Have you tried any other module or plugin that have this functionality? If you can find one, let me know and I can see how others do it. Regards, /kksou
item.dc:creator: kksou

item.title: LenaTime says:
item.description: My last post wasn't very clearly written, but you get the jest of what I'm saying right? So not having a print feature may be a show-stopper for some of my clients. Not sure yet. I am hoping you'll be able to add a print feature! Thanks again for your great work!
item.dc:creator: LenaTime

item.title: LenaTime says:
item.description: Great app! It's is really light-weight and relatively easy to install. I emailed you about a print function, but I see it is, or has, already been addressed several times. I will also send you a payment for each site I use it on. Though I hope the none print function may be show-stopper, so to speak. I hope not because I like how light and easy your product is. Anyway, do you have any plans for adding a print function?

item.title: kksou says:
item.description: Hi, The entire googlemap is returned by google.com. It's not set in my plugin. Please refer to googleMaps documentation: http://google-maps-utility-library-v3.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/infobox/docs/reference.html Search for "class InfoBoxOptions" and then the "boxClass" properties. You will see that the CSS is defined by "infoBox". So try to set "infoBox" in your Joomla style sheet and see if you can change the font color or background color. Regards, /kksou
item.dc:creator: kksou

item.title: prysmos says:
item.description: Hi This is a very nice and useful plugin,thank you for providing it for free. It works fine however I have a small glitch on my side. The direction talk bubble graphic is broken and the text is set to white which is not visible unless you highlight it. Here the sample image http://i43.tinypic.com/wmc5w.jpg Just in case you need to look at codes here is the link of my site http://guesthousehuahinbdl.com/index.php/en/locations/get-direction/transportation Thanks

item.title: kksou says:
item.description: Hi, 1) Can you show me a url that displays this? Will need to do a view source of the page to gather more clues as to what might be the problem. 2) Currently joomla/google does not provide an API to do so. Regards, /kksou
item.dc:creator: kksou

item.title: mattb says:
item.description: Hello, I have recently started using the To Here plugin for googleDirections and I have 2 questions regarding its function: 1) When the directions appear sometimes it is duplicated? Is there anyone to stop this from happening? 2)After the directions have been generated, I click on the print button within my Joomla page and it opens a new window to print from, however it is just the map without the directions and it requires you to reinsert the address you are coming from. Is it possible to have the print screen keep the original "Coming from" address in that print window along with the directions and map? Thanks.
item.dc:creator: mattb

item.title: Shonn says:
item.description: Is it possible to not ask this to do more, but actually less? Could i get it to pull only the miles and travel time and nothing more? Ignore the directions and the map just produce the simple miles apart and projected travel time? I am comfortable with adjusting code if its even possible to do in this case.

item.title: kksou says:
item.description: Hi, Please refer to the tutorial: googleDirections - To Here - plugin Tutorial 01: Getting Started: http://www.kksou.com/php-gtk2/Joomla-Tips-Techniques/googleDirections-To-Here-plugin-Tutorial-01-Getting-Started.php Please try the sample code there first and see if it works on your server. If it works, then replace with your address. Please also use the Google Geocoder v2.0: http://www.kksou.com/php-gtk2/google-geocoder-v2/, key in your address and double check that your longitude and latitude are correct. Regards, /kksou
item.dc:creator: kksou

item.title: kksou says:
item.description: Hi Christoph, Sorry for not replying earlier. I actually tried to work on the feature, but it's not as easy as it seems. Google does not provide any API for this purpose, so you basically have to write the code yourself from scratch to achieve what you've mentioned. Will let you know if I managed to get it working. Regards, /kksou
item.dc:creator: kksou

item.title: kksou says:
item.description: Hi, This is a simple plugin with one purpose in mind: to give direction from Point A (one specified by user) to your designated place. It does not do other things, like the one your desired. There are many other heavy-weight plugins which do very complicated stuff. You might want to try those in joomla.org and see if there's one that suit your needs. Regards, /kksou
item.dc:creator: kksou

item.description: Hi thanks for the plug in i am using the googleDirection-tohere plug in. I need to add a 3 mile radius from a postcode on the map and want to display a message to postcodes outside the 3 mile radius. Thanks

item.description: Hi Charlene, Have just emailed you a modified version that should make the codes disappear. Do let me know if it works, ok? Regards, /kksou

item.title: kksou says:
item.description: Hi, Do you want to elaborate what are you trying to achieve? The plugin is for a simple purpose: You want to allow people to go from Point A to your place (Point B). There's only one Point B. So why should there be multiple markers? Regards, /kksou
item.dc:creator: kksou

item.description: Hey there, I'm using a Joomla version 1.5 and installed the correct version of this plugin corrosponding to my joomla but whenever I embed the code:{googleDir_tohere width=320 height=360 dir_width=275 home_addr="Handelstraat 9, 7817 RC Geesbrug, Nederland" lang=de} The top of my page shows: table.googleDirections_tohere td { font-family: Verdana, Arial, sans serif; font-size: 11px; margin: 2px; } table.googleDirections_tohere th { background-color:#EEEEEE; } table.googleDirections_tohere img { color: #000000; } table.googleDirections_tohere button { font-family: Verdana, Arial, sans serif; font-size: 11px; } table.googleDirections_tohere input { font-family: Verdana, Arial, sans serif; font-size: 11px; } Can't seem to get rid of this code not sure what I've done wrong here. item.title: Patryk says:

item.title: kksou says:
item.description: Hi, For (1) How to turn on the bicycle mode? Please refer to: Tutorial 03: Travel Modes http://www.kksou.com/php-gtk2/Joomla-Tips-Techniques/googleDirections-To-Here-plugin-Tutorial-03-Travel-Modes.php For (2) How to turn on street view? Did you see the yellow "Pegman" on the top left hand corner of the map? Click and drag that Pegman to the place you want to see the street view. Details here: http://maps.google.com/help/maps/streetview/learn/using-street-view.html For (3) Can't get the label to be seen on map Please refer to: Tutorial 02: Adding Label to Home Address http://www.kksou.com/php-gtk2/Joomla-Tips-Techniques/googleDirections-To-Here-plugin-Tutorial-02-Adding-Label-to-Home-Address.phpa Regards, /kksou
item.dc:creator: kksou

item.title: Patryk says:
item.description: Hello this plugin is supperiour. But got three questions: 1/ How to turn on the bicycle mode? 2/ How to turn on street view? 3/ Can't get the label to be seen on map.
item.dc:creator: Patryk
